chargeHist.descr: Transfer Encumbered Property (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E. Vetrone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Transfer Another's Personal Property (Value does not Exceed $500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.84(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Steven E. Vetrone
parties.address: N3644 Blackhawk Rd., Pine River, WI 54965

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders payments of no less than $300 per month to commence May 1, 2016 and each month until paid in full.     In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with the victim as named in the complaint. Court prohibits the defendant from transferring any vehicle requiring a title without agent approval.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

records.addlTxt: from Agent Raymond - DE has been revoked from probation - Remaining restitution totaling $1263.34 to be converted to a civil judgment.
Paid in full at Clerk of Courts
Probation review hearing on April 3, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 10:37 am case called. Defendant Steven E. Vetrone in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions parties regarding resolution. Defendant states he agrees to the terms of offer. ADA states resolution on record.  Amend to Transfer Encumbered Personal Property-Misd. in violation of 943.84(2)(a) & 943.91(1).  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accept amendment of the State. Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by victim. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defedant to: Impose 5 months WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. CONDITIONS: Restitution of $3,330.00 to be paid in increments of no less than $300 per month commencing May 1, 2016. Defendant is prohibited from transferring any vehicle requiring a title without agent approval. No contact with victim as named in the complaint.  Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Terms of Agent. $200 fine plus costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called @ 3:35 p.m.  Defendant Steven E. Vetrone in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Defendant has had a pre-trial conference on March 3, 2016 and needed time to consider the offer. DE is close to accepting an offer but is requesting additional time.  The Court will adjourn the IA and will schedule a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case Recalled @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Steven E. Vetrone in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def states he did not qualify for SPD services due to assets owned.  Court will appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit of $250 no later than 3/4/2016 with a payment plan to commence on 4/1/2016 of $50 per month.  Def states he has no funds to pay a deposit and will have to represent himself.  Def wishes to conduct a PTC with the DA.  Court understands that a waiver of counsel has occurred to allow Def to speak with the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Steven E. Vetrone in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and requests SPD.  Def is not working.    Def is referred to SPD for eligibility and to meet with SPD following Court today.  ADA argues for $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Statement as to bond conditions by Def.  AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $3330.00
